dataIdInfo.idAbs: Transportation Route Restrictions identify streets designated as heavy truck routes as defined by a particular municipality. Current coverage includes the CMA boundaries for the 13 capital cities of each province and territory, the capital of Canada, and cities having a combined 1996 Census population of 500,000 or greater. The exception is Iqualuit where only the CSD boundary was utilized. The Transportation Route Restrictions file is a lookup table that can be linked back to the Roads (RTE) file via RDS_ID in TRR and UNIQUEID in RTE. The contents of this file included such data as Time & Day Restrictions, Vehicle Clearance, Underpass, Overpass, Weight Restriction and more.

Consts.useLimit: As Per End User License Agreement

citeinfo.title: Transportation Route Restrictions (TRR)

descript.abstract: Transportation Route Restrictions identify streets designated as heavy truck routes as defined by a particular municipality. Current coverage includes the CMA boundaries for the 13 capital cities of each province and territory, the capital of Canada, and cities having a combined 1996 Census population of 500,000 or greater. The exception is Iqualuit where only the CSD boundary was utilized. The Transportation Route Restrictions file is a lookup table that can be linked back to the Roads (RTE) file via RDS_ID in TRR and UNIQUEID in RTE. The contents of this file included such data as Time & Day Restrictions, Vehicle Clearance, Underpass, Overpass, Weight Restriction and more.
descript.supplinf: This data layer began with the Heavy Trucks layer. It was decided that the TRR layer should be more then just truck routes, it should encompass all information pertaining to the Transportation industry. Therefore the addition of other information like bridge height and weight restriction information will be included as a starting point to broaden the spectrum of the TRR layer. As source information became available for major cities and capitals, heavy truck routes were added into the TRR layer
descript.purpose: To create a nation-wide table based layer consisting all heavy truck and bridge information to enhance the Route file

dataLineage.statement: This data layer began with the Heavy Trucks layer. It was decided that the TRR layer should be more then just truck routes, it should encompass all information pertaining to the Transportation industry. Therefore the addition of other information like bridge height and weight restriction information will be included as a starting point to broaden the spectrum of the TRR layer. As source information became available for major cities and capitals, heavy truck routes were added into the TRR layer
